item.title: Want Cheap Power, Fast? Solar and Wind Firms Have a Suggestion.
item.description: Renewable energy companies are shifting strategy under President Trump, emphasizing the economic benefits of low-carbon electricity.

item.title: Kremlin Stays Mum on Agenda for Putin’s Call With Trump
item.description: The call, scheduled for Tuesday, will be the first known conversation between the two leaders since Mr. Putin laid out numerous conditions for a cease...

item.title: In North Macedonia, Officials Investigate Lapses in Deadly Nightclub Fire
item.description: At least 59 people died and more than 150 were injured in the inferno. The authorities said the venue’s hospitality permit had been issued illegally.

item.title: Telegram’s Pavel Durov, Charged With Range of Crimes, Is Allowed to Leave France
item.description: Pavel Durov said that the investigation into illicit activity on the messaging app he runs is ongoing, but that he had returned home to Dubai.

item.title: How Ukraine’s Offensive in Russia’s Kursk Region Unraveled
item.description: At the height of the campaign, Ukrainian forces controlled some 500 square miles of Russian territory. Now they hold just a small sliver of land along...
